heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 26 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (221°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.5°C) and outside temperature (up 2.4°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 3303 lux), cloud levels (down 138 m), and pressure (up 5 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 5189 lux), cloud levels (up 156 m), and feels like temperature (up 1.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 138.0m higher than yesterday, 114.4m higher than the past week, 155.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 604m to 2320m and averaged 1189.9m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and near calm conditions. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and light levels will be low during the day. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
